com.markussecundus.forms.elements

Interface UberElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, Extensible
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    UberDrawable<Rend,Pos>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicAbstractLayout, BasicGridLayout, BasicLinearLayout, PrimitivePositionalLayout

    public interface UberElement
extends Element, Extensible
    Basic inteface for any Element that groups together multiple other Elements.
    Author:
    MarkusSecundus
    See Also:
    Element, UberDrawable

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.markussecundus.forms.extensibility.Extensible

        Extensible.ImplementationThroughMemoryLeak

    • Method Summary

      default java.util.List<Element> getChildren()
      Shinier shortcut for calling children().get().
      ConstProperty<java.util.List<Element>> children()

      • Methods inherited from interface com.markussecundus.forms.extensibility.Extensible

        getExtension, getExtensionsMap

    • Method Detail

      • children

        ConstProperty<java.util.List<Element>> children()
        Instance of List containing only and all the children, that are to be updated in the game loop. Use it to add children to this, to remove them or to change their arrangement in any other way possible.

      • getChildren

        default java.util.List<Element> getChildren()
        Shinier shortcut for calling children().get().

      • update

        default void update(float delta,
                    int frameId)
        Called each frame of the game loop. Default implementation distributes the update to all the children.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Element
        Parameters:
        delta - the time in milliseconds elapsed from the last call of update
        frameId - the identifier of the current frame - can be used to detect skipped frames or update being called multiple times in one frame - incremented by 1 on each frame - does not uniquely define the frame, asi the number of frames in one game run is unlimited, unlike the capacity of int type
